page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content:
EDUCATION IN THE OMAGH AREA (LOUISE MULSHAW, 3 PAGES)
The old Culmore School was built in 1914. The bricks from the old jail in Omagh were brought from the jail to make a school that was then called Cornabracken the site of which is just around the corner from our present school which is in the process of being extended. The subjects we study in our school are English, Maths, History, Geography, Religion, Needlework, P.E. and Craft. We also have Netball for girls and football for boys. We have over 370 children in our school and this includes the Partially Hearing Units for children that cannot hear very well. School starts in the morning at 9.15 a.m. Our first break is at 10.40 a.m.
